1 The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

   The City of Florence Water/Wastewater Department as operators of the Cypress Creek Wastewater Treatment
    Plant are committed to employee, public and environmental saftey. This commitment is demonstrated by our 
    accidental prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance
    and training. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.
    It is also our policiy to provide training for all of our employees that handle any regulated substance. If a release 
    occurs we are coordinated with the City of Florence Fire Department, which provides emergency response personnel
    to control and mitigate the effects of the release, also we are cordinated with tha Florence Lauderdale EMA office to
    provide any personnel or equipment that we may need.

2 The Facility and The Regulated Substance Handled

   The Cypress Creek Wastewater Treatment Plant primary process is to treat the City of Florence wastewater to meet
   or exceed all Federal and State regulations so that the treated wastewater can be released into the receving stresm.
   We have one regulated substance at this facility. This substance is Chlorine. The Chlorine used at this facility is
   used for the purpose of disinfecting the treated wastewater from the City of Florence. 

   The maximum inventory of Chlorine at this facility is 24,000 pounds.

3  The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

    This facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requriments set
    out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections brefily describe the elements of the release 
    prevention program that is in place at our facility.

    Process Saftey Information

    The Cypress Creek Wastewater Treatment Plant maintains saftey informa

tion that describes the hazards of 
    Chlorine, operating parameters and procedures and equipment designs associated with the chlorinationn process.

    Process Hazard Review

    This facility conducts reviews regularly to ensure that hazards associated with our process is identified and
    controlled. The reviews are done by our plant superintendent and lead maintenance personnel.

    Training
   
    This facility has a training program in place to ensure all personnel are trained in the hazards and safe
    handling of chlorine. This program requries each employee that handles Chlorine to take refresher training
    every three years. All of our employees are grade IV certified operators in the State of Alabama.

     Maintenance

     This facility maintenance personnel peform maintenance checks on all process equipment to ensure proper 
     operations.The equipment checked include storage tanks, pipeing and valve systems,relief and vent systems,
     emergency shut down systems and controls. If any deficiencies are found they are corrected in a safe and 
     timely manner. All maintenance personnel are offered specialized training as needed.

     Employee Participation

     All employees at this facility are encourged to express their views on accidental release prevention and to 
    recommend improvements.

4   The Five Year Accident History

     This facility has an excellent record of preventing any accidental release over the last 5 years. There has been no
     accidental release from this facility during this period.

5   The Emergency Program

     This facility has coordinated with the Florence Fire Department and the Florence Lauderdale EMA to respond with
     emergency personnel as needed in any accidental release. All personnel are requried to update their training every 
     three years, also specialized training is done as needed. We have not done any drills to this point. This facility has
     a public notification system in place t

o notify the public in the event of a accidental release.

6   Planned Changes to Improve Saftey

    There are some changes this facility needs to make to improve saftey. Plans are currently being made to have a 
    drill with the Florence Fire Department and Florence Lauderdale EMA on our energency response. We with the
    City of Florence Water Department are committed to saftey and are always looking to improve saftey, as we see new
    saftey measures we will implement them as soon a possible.
